content:
China and Canada, squabbling over the arrests of their citizens, have both claimed the other to be in breach of diplomatic rules

EARLIER THIS month Justin Trudeau, Canada’s prime minister, accused China of violating international law by interrogating Michael Kovrig, who was on leave from the Canadian foreign ministry and working for an international organisation when China detained him in December. The arrests of Mr Kovrig and Michael Spavor, a Canadian businessman, followed Canada’s detaining of Meng Wanzhou, the chief financial officer of Huawei, at the request of the United States. In questioning Mr Kovrig, China did not respect “the principles of diplomatic immunity”, says Mr Trudeau, referring to the Vienna Convention. China not so respectfully disagreed. Last year it accused Canada of violating that same Convention by organising a letter signed by 15 ambassadors protesting against China’s treatment of its Muslim minority. What is the Vienna Convention?

Rules governing the care of foreign emissaries have been worked out over millennia by rulers and governments who wanted their representatives returned to them in one piece. At first they were agreed on a bilateral basis or among small groups. It was not until the Congress of Vienna of 1815 that a start was made on codifying them as international law. That first set of rules dealt with what governments felt was the most pressing matter: the order of precedence among ambassadors and envoys. The short-lived League of Nations took a stab at expanding the rulebook to cover diplomatic privileges and immunities, but dropped the effort in 1927 as not important enough to pursue. In 1952 the United Nations decided that writing a comprehensive rulebook was a priority. This was done at the urging of Yugoslavia, whose representative complained that Nazi and fascist governments and the Soviet Union were violating diplomacy’s unwritten tenets.

The Vienna Convention on diplomatic Relations, which was agreed in 1961 and went into force in 1964, sets out how sovereign states can establish, maintain and, if need be, terminate diplomatic relations. It defines who is a diplomat and thus entitled to special privileges and immunities. These include immunity from civil and criminal prosecution in the host state and exemption from all dues and taxes. These provisions have allowed embassies in London to leave unpaid £115m in congestion charges as of September 2018 and diplomats in New York to ignore parking tickets worth an estimated US$15.6m before the city started confiscating the licence plates of violators in 2002.

Mr Kovrig’s immunity under the convention, which includes exemption from arrest or detention, mostly ended when he took a leave of absence from the government to work for the International Crisis Group, a think-tank. Yet a small sliver of it remains, covering any of his activities performed while still a diplomat. This is what led to Mr Trudeau’s accusation. China points to a different part of the convention, which stipulates that diplomats should not interfere in the internal affairs of the host country, to support its claim that Canada violated international law in organising the ambassadorial letter. Either country can take its beef to the International Court of Justice, which the US did in 1979 when Iran held more than 50 Americans hostage for more than a year. The Chinese-Canadian diplomatic spat has not reached that point yet.

wp.Privilege separation: 权限分离;特权分离;特权隔离

ex: n. 特权；优待
vt. 给予…特权；特免
eg2: Or maybe they just have bad taste, but that is their .
或者也许他们只是有很差的品味，但那是他们的特权。
Who gave you or anyone else the  to intentionally inflict damage upon anything?
谁给了你或者其他任何人特权去故意破坏任何事物了？
No one shall have the  of transcending the law.
不允许任何人有超越法律的特权。

wp.private prosecution: 自诉;自诉案件;刑事自诉;患者自诉
wp.wrongful prosecution: 非法的告发;非法的检举;非法检举;非法告发

ex: n. 起诉，检举；进行；经营
eg2: They have the prosecution responsibility.
他们有起诉的责任。
The  was brought under the emergency act.
这起控诉归入紧急法令。
It also includes immunity from prosecution for Saleh and his family.
它还包括萨利赫和他的家人免遭起诉的内容。

ex: n. 提供；条款；供给；供应品
v. 为…提供所需物品（尤指食物）
网络 规定；预备；准备
eg2: housing provision
住房供应
The government is responsible for the provision of health care.
政府负责提供医疗服务。
There is no provision for anyone to sit down here.
这里没有可坐的地方。
The provision of specialist teachers is being increased.
当局正在增加设置专门师资。
He had already made provisions for(= planned for the financial future of) his wife and children before the accident.
意外事故发生之前，他已为妻子、儿女做好了经济安排。
You should make provision for things going wrong.
你要采取措施，以防不测。
Under the provisions of the lease, the tenant is responsible for repairs.
按契约规定，房客负责房屋维修。

ex: adv. 尊敬地

wp.Listening respectfully: 听力恭敬地;恭敬地听;听敬

eg2: Being respectful: When you tell your father what you think he should do, do so .
要尊重他：当你告诉你父亲你认为他应该怎么做的时候，要恭敬且有礼貌。
You can disagree with me, but you have to do so respectfully if you want your comment to be treated with any respect.
你也可以不同意我的观点，但如果你希望自己的言论被别人尊重，那么你所做的行为也要值得他人尊重。
The rep replies, "You can talk to me , as I do, because I have nothing to do personally with what is happening to you.
客服代表回应，“你可以带有尊重的跟我谈话，就像我这样，因为对你发生的事情我什么也做不了。”

ex: n. 规则手册

wp.Ariel Sliver: 艾丽尔正品店;艾丽儿银饰正品店

ex: n. 梳毛，梳棉；裂片
vi. 成为薄片；裂成小片
vt. 使成薄片；使裂成小片
eg2: In the space of all possible lifes, life on Earth is but a tiny  -- one attempt at creativity.
在所有可能有生命存在的空间里，地球上孕育的生命只占那么一小条――创造性的一次努力。
Only the  of land that is almost impossible to see from the road will remain the sanctum of his high-value crop.
只有这块地的一小片将会继续种植他的高价值的庄稼，要从公路上看见这块地几乎不可能。
To heed more rational monetary considerations in the face of an unfair offer, she says, requires that you "swallow your pride"--or the  of pie--which is a form of emotional control.
为了在一个不公平的出价面前听从更理性的出于金融的考虑，需要”吞下你的自尊“或者干脆吃掉给你的那一小片派，这才是情绪控制。

wp.sovereign wealth: 主权财富;所谓主权财产;所谓主权财富
wp.sovereign equality: 主权平等;主权平等原则
wp.sovereign risk: 主权风险;政治风险;管辖权风险;国家主权风险
wp.Sovereign Hill: 疏芬山;淘金镇;疏芬山淘金镇;索福林山

ex: adj. 至高无上的；有主权的；拥有最高统治权的；不折不扣的；极好的
n. 君主；独立国；最高统治者
n. (Sovereign)人名；(英)索夫林
eg2: In England, the  reigns but does not rule.
在英国，君主是国家元首，但不治理国事。
We stay in southern Africa for this next peculiarity as we focus in on the world’s only sovereign state to be completely surrounded by one other state, namely South Africa.
同样是在非洲南部，来看下面这个奇怪的国界——让我们聚焦于这个世界上唯一一个被另一个国家——南非——包围着，却有独立主权的国家。
Morocco is a  independent monartery.
摩洛哥是个有主权的独立君主国。

ex: vi. 发生口角；大声争吵
vt. 弄乱（排好的铅字）
n. 争吵；口角
eg2: But this conflict is really a family .
但是这次冲突实际上是一场家庭争吵。
After a family , her son, Clifton Jenes Jr., 20, threatened to harm himself, led police on a car chase through downtown and then jumped from the Fourth Street bridge.
在一场家庭争吵以后 她20岁的儿子克里夫顿.詹尼斯以自残威胁她 致使警方开着汽车冲过市中心 然后闯进第四号街桥。
This was a light -hearted article about a small family squabble where the husband “walked out” on his wife.
这是一篇轻幽默的问扎国内，讲的是一个小家庭之中因为丈夫“背叛”妻子而发生口角的事。

ex: vt. 刺；刺伤；戳；刺穿；直入
vi. 刺；刺伤；戳；刺痛
n. 刺；戳；尝试；突发的一阵
n. (Stab)人名；(泰)萨达

wp.Back Stab: 暗箭难防;芒刺在身;背击
wp.Gelatin stab: 胶基针刺培养;明胶穿刺

eg2: There are groups of Jellyfish in the lake, but they do not stab people. Divers can swim with jellyfish, or pick them up without worrying about injuries.
湖中水母成群，但它们不会刺人，潜水者可以与水母一同畅游，或者捧起它们观赏，完全不必担心会受伤。
Photos show a stab wound in his neck.
照片显示他的脖子上有刺伤的伤口。

ex: vi. 规定；保证
vt. 规定；保证
adj. 有托叶的
eg2: Can you stipulate they would carry out the treaty?
你能保证他们会执行该条约吗?
The contract would stipulate reimbursements at any point the engagement is called off.
该协议将规定在任何时间段取消婚约应支付的赔偿。
If not, he said, it should stipulate having the self-defense forces as a military capability.
他说，如果不废除，就应规定把自卫队当作一种军事能力而保有。

ex: n. 原则；信条；教义
n. (Tenet)人名；(法)特内；(英)特尼特
eg2: 3: Services share schema and contract, not class(So do all of my OO programs with interface and classes.
信条3：服务共享数据定义与契约，而非类。 （我所有的采用接口与类的OO程序都满足这条。
Its basic tenet is that Russia’s destiny is to be a great power, a greatness that must be fostered in the face of Western attempts to undermine it.
其基本原则是俄罗斯与生俱来就应该成为强国，纵然面对西方干扰与阻碍的企图，这种伟大的强国之梦也必须得到实现。
4: Service compatibility is based upon policy(This is a good start: the types and scope of policy can shape an architecture.
信条4：服务兼容性根据策略来确定。 （这条还算不错：策略的类型和范围可以塑造一个架构。

wp.Terminate Section: 终止截面;结束段;终止剖面

ex: vt. 使终止；使结束；解雇
vi. 结束，终止；结果
adj. 结束的
eg2: In this example, we want it to .
在本例中，我们希望终止脚本。
each process branch with an end or stop node.
用一个结束或停止节点终止每个流程分支
At this point, the client and server terminate their connections.
此时，客户机和服务器将终止它们的连接。

ex: adj. 未付款的；[税收] 未缴纳的；无报酬的

wp.VAT unpaid: 未交增值税;增值税未付;增值税不付;未交升值税

eg2: “I was an unpaid intern and I had no problem with it, ” he said.
“我曾经就是一个无薪的实习生，我觉得这没什么，”他说到。
If your credit card balances go , your credit score will start to diminish.
如果你信用卡欠款余额未支付，你的信用评分就开始降低。
If you can’t find a position in paid employment, try to find a post as an () trainee.
如果你不能在有偿就业中找到一个工作岗位，那就找到一个（无薪的）见习岗位。

wp.Unwritten Rules: 潜规则;不成文的规矩;不成文规定

ex: adj. 不成文的；口头的；没有记录的
eg2: It is one of the unwritten laws of business, a matter of simple percentages.
这句话是商业经营的不成文规则，就是简单的百分比问题。
I mean, we are a “breaking” kind of crowd, and, there’s an unwritten rule that you have to be able to provide an answer other than “nowhere” when someone asks where you went for break.
我是说，我们是一群被割裂的人群，在我们中有一个不成文的规定，那就是当别人问起去哪里度假时，你必须给出一个答案，但是决不能说“哪儿也不去”。
These are the unwritten rules that have nothing to do with office politics, a college degree or a past success, these are about YOU.
这些不成文的规定无关乎政治政策,无关乎是否有大学学历证书或是曾经的辉煌,而恰恰是在于 你 自己.

ex: vt. 违反；侵犯，妨碍；亵渎
n. 违背者；违反者；妨碍者
eg2: But by 1980 Israel was the last major violator of the arms embargo.
但到了1980年以色列是违反武器禁运的最后一个主要国家。
He pointed his baton behind him, then spun around to confront the . A sharp whistle.
他指着他身后的指挥棒，转过身来面对着违规者。
Until late last year, the most a  had to worry about was paying a $500 penalty for misleading the public.
直到去年，违法者最多因为误导公众而被罚款500美元。

Title: What is the Vienna Convention?

paperStatistics.title: What is the Vienna Convention?
paperStatistics.desc: China and Canada, squabbling over the arrests of their citizens, have both claimed the other to be in breach of diplomatic rules
